meanings.definition: relating to a nerve or the nervous system
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the neural signals travel between the brain and the body.
meanings.sent2: The neural pathways in the body help us react to danger quickly.
meanings.sent3: I told a joke so bad, it seemed to short-circuit my neural connections!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a burst of neural energy, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The neural response to fear is a natural survival instinct.

meanings.definition: of or relating to a neuron or neurons
meanings.sent1: The neural network in the brain processes information at lightning speed.
meanings.sent2: The neural activity in the brain increases when solving puzzles.
meanings.sent3: The robot's neural programming made it dance like a pro!
meanings.sent4: His words sparked a neural connection, triggering a flood of memories.
meanings.sent5: The neural structure of the brain is incredibly complex and fascinating.

meanings.definition: involving or affecting the nerves or nervous system
meanings.sent1: The neural disorder caused tingling sensations in her fingers.
meanings.sent2: The neural damage from the accident affected his ability to walk.
meanings.sent3: The neural overload from too much studying made her fall asleep mid-sentence!
meanings.sent4: The news sent a shockwave through her neural system, leaving her speechless.
meanings.sent5: The neural response to pain is the body's way of protecting itself.
